instruction: The following text is part of a research paper. Based on the contents, identify the research paper's major conclusion. |EoS|

input: "In this paper, we present a novel method for the detection of malicious code. We first define a taxonomy of malware, and then introduce a system to automatically detect malware. We then propose a novel technique to automatically generate a signature that can detect malware. We evaluate our system on a number of samples of malware and show that our technique can reliably detect malware. Our system is able to achieve a 94.4% detection rate on our samples. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first system to automatically detect malicious code."
output: "The system is able to achieve a 94.4% detection rate on our samples."
|EoS|

instruction: Summarize the following paragraph, and provide the summary as the output. |EoS|
raw_instances:
input: “Sailing has always been an important part of my life,” said Mark Reynolds, a British sailor who is a multiple times world champion. “I got into sailing by mistake, because my dad was trying to learn how to sail and we went out in an old wooden boat and he didn’t know how to sail. I would say that my love for sailing really stemmed from that experience.” Reynolds competed in the 1996 Olympic Games in Atlanta and is a 5-time world champion in the “Star” class of boat. Mark Reynolds is now the president of the British Sailing Team.
output: Sailing has always been an important part of my life, said Mark Reynolds, a British sailor who is a multiple times world champion. I got into sailing by mistake, because my dad was trying to learn how to sail and we went out in an old wooden boat and he didn't know how to sail. I would say that my love for sailing really stemmed from that experience. 
Mark Reynolds competed in the 1996 Olympic Games in Atlanta and is a 5-time world champion in the “Star” class of boat. Mark Reynolds is now the president of the British Sailing Team.
|EoS|

input: The U.S. economy will grow at a faster pace next year than previously expected, as the country's central bank is set to raise interest rates at a faster pace over the next two years, according to new projections released Wednesday. The Federal Reserve's updated projections show that the economy will expand at a 3.4% pace in 2019, up from its previous forecast of 3.1%. The central bank also said it expects the unemployment rate to fall to 3.5% by the end of next year, down from 4.1% now. The central bank's 17 policymakers also raised their economic growth expectations for 2020 to 3.2% from 3.1% previously.
